nodes.bodyText: I think it can be int. I will try to change it and see if the build will succeed.
I think adding @NonNullByDefault to DTO classes is not necessary and avoids your problems.
Ok I will remove these. I just added from the Travis warnings, didn't checked that it might be needed or not :)
That won‘t work. Either provide a default and use int or @nullable and Integer.
I stayed with int and provided a default value.

It doesn't make sense to provide any of these as null, right? You should make a null-check before instantiating ICloudConnection (found it in startHandler, if any of the required credentials is null, set the thing to OFFLINE/CONFIGURATION_ERROR with a message stating what is wrong)

Yes this makes sense. However if I add a null check for these parameters where this function is called, then this Nullable annotation can be removed right?
Will the tests succeeds even if there is a NonNullByDefault annotation? So these tests are non-static tests right?
Exactly, the @Nullable should be removed then. If the tests fail then, there is a bug.
same here. calling findMyDevice with a id == null doesn't make sense.
see above. if deviceId is null, it doesn't make sense to call findmydevice
since connection is @Nullable, please add a null-check here
not sure here (didn't check the whole code): is there any useful case where key == null is possible? if not, check for null where this is instantiated.
